reviews.text: My room on the 12th floor certainly wasn't one of those pictured in the marketing material. The chipped and worn furniture looked like it hadn't been replaced since the 1970's. The room had a VCR- given the state of the rest of the room, I wouldn't have been surprised if it was Betamax! (it wasn't).
reviews.title: In desperate need of renovation

reviews.text: Every time the minibar thermostat kicked in and switched on and off, the whole surrounding unit would judder loudly, waking me up on more than one occasion.
reviews.title: OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location isn't even that great- it's very convenient for subway, train and airport bus, but if you want to explore the immediate area on foot, there's very little to do and see.
reviews.title: Turned out much better than expected !

likes.disliked: — Make sure to stay on a high floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was a bit average. Big note: children are not allowed in the swimming pool. Much to the disappointment of our children, we did not pick up on this when we booked otherwise we would have gone elsewhere. Location is OK. Did not eat there so could not comment on food.
reviews.title: Horrible rooms

likes.disliked: — The rooms (unless you are lucky enough to be on the upper floors)

reviews.title: Average Hotel in an Average Location
reviews.text: We stayed five nights using my Starwood points. It was our first stay in Osaka and just had to take a chance to find somewhere to stretch my points despite the reviews on this hotel. It turned out that we were pleasantly surprised.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is nice, just slightly dated. When you walk in, you will feel like you walked into a hotel from the late 80s/early 90s. The rooms are very clean and we espeically love it because they even upgraded us to a junior suite - given that it is our honeymoon. This hotel is esp. well worth it because if you have Starwood points, it's
reviews.title: Nice (slightly dated) hotel

reviews.text: only 4,000-5,000 points per night. The weekends are even less points then the weekdays.
reviews.title: good hotel, good location

likes.liked: — the location and the comfortable beds
likes.disliked: — buffet breakfast was the same everyday

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is pretty good too. It's right next to the Kintetsu station, where you can take 2 stops to Namba, which is the hip, cool area where restaurants, shops and bars are. If you want to get on the JR, you will need to take the train for 1 stop, then change to the the JR Osaka loop line.
reviews.title: good - if you are in the newly renovated rooms

likes.disliked: — language skills from the staff members

reviews.text: The staff at the hotel was very friendly and when we tried to tip them, they did not accept any! They are very focused on service and said they charge for the service and do not expect anything else. (wow!)
reviews.title: A good deal for what I paid

reviews.text: Concierge was also decent. They listen very well in english, but spoken is not as good - but we managed to figure what they were trying to say. Restaurants recommendations were always good - they like to point to old, known, established restaurants, so the food is always great!
reviews.title: Sheraton price, old Miyako quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at Sheraton Miyako in January 2008 and some parts of the hotel were under renovation. Some floors were totally revamped to "Sheraton standard" but some floor were still stuck in the 1970s era Howard Johnson motel standard.
reviews.title: Not quite Sheraton standard...

likes.disliked: — need to update and upgrade some of the furnishings, furniture, etc

reviews.text: Apparently before Sheraton took it over, it was locally managed Miyako Hotel. You could still see reminiscene of it in parts of the hotel (logo on hotel towels etc). Parts of the hotel that's open to the public are wholly renovated and look nice. Parts of the hotel that are for guests still need renovation.
reviews.title: A comfortable choice

likes.liked: — Clean, spacious, comfortable, in good condition
likes.disliked: — not a lot of information on local sites

reviews.text: I was unlucky enough to get stuck in the old-styled room with what must have been 30 year old mattress and a bathroom with a door that belongs more to airline bathrooms than a hotel bathroom - thin with clip looking door handle and made of plastic. And forget the decor - there isn't any. The TV had cable box that didn't quite work unless you held the remote above your head (there is a written instuction that tells you to do that exactly). No safe box in the room. The only upside to the place is that it's clean. Although the place desparately needs renovation, the room is amazingly clean, well organized that is.
reviews.title: Terrific location, though rooms need to be made consistent

likes.disliked: — Dont know what kind of room you'll get!

reviews.text: Transportation is awesome. This hotel sits on top of a subway station. And there is a department store adjacent to it.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

likes.liked: — Clean, comfortable, lots of activity around the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Insider note here: try to get rooms with number that ends in even number (if you can). The even ending numbers have sitting area with sofa and coffee table whereas the odd numbers have no sitting area but just a bed and that look out to back of the hotel.
reviews.title: Exceptionally Sheraton!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Miyako last week for 3 nights after liking the look of it on the web and trusting that a Sheraton would be of a high standard. We were very impressed when we first arrived as the lobby of the hotel is absolutely beautiful, but got something of a surprise when we stepped out of the lift on the 8th floor to go to our room.
reviews.title: Beware - massive variation in quality of rooms!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The difference in decoration was immediately apparent - the carpets looked old and tatty, and the walls and ceiling clearly needed some work too. Upon entering our room it felt like we'd stepped back in time - the other reviews saying that the rooms are like something from the 70s aren't joking. The room itself was clean and tidy, but the furniture and decoration was very old and worn, and definitely didn't come close to what we'd been expecting. We took a quick look at the reviews on here and saw that parts of the hotel had been renovated but that we'd been given one of the old rooms.
reviews.title: Nice Stay, Good Location

likes.liked: — Convenient from airport and great subway access
likes.disliked: — Neighborhood of hotel was pretty quiet

reviews.title: A Nice Stay...but Nothing to Get Excited Over
reviews.text: We made a complaint to the management, who after some discussion offered to upgrade us free of charge and the room they gave us was very nice. Had we been given a room like that to begin with we'd have given the hotel 4 stars at least.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall I would recommend this hotel, but definitely make sure you are getting one of the newer rooms, as it's like two completely different hotels in one at the moment. The location is good, being next to the train and subway stations, as well as having a decent shopping centre nearby.
reviews.title: Very Average

likes.disliked: — Old and service can be improved

reviews.text: We had a premium sweet sleeper room with a king size bed, which was very comfortable. The shower had great water pressure (better than I have at home) and the bathroom had the usual plethora of amenities.
reviews.title: Overnight Stay
